content.description: Start with both hands on the obvious jug in the middle of the face and dyno from there to the top. Get your left foot in the circle slopey kind of spot and jump with all of your power from there. No need for climbing shoes for this problem. Grade is easier or harder depending on your height, dynos are like that.
content.protection: None, it'd be hard to bring a bouldering pad on a river trip. Sand is pretty soft. I did do some bouldering at other spots on the river and used a drybag with a pad inside of it for sit starts.
content.location: This route is in the center of the boulder where it is highest. To find this boulder after stopping here with a river company, you would hike along the river shore back upstream a ways from the geo-cache and big tree.
